definition: to fill or stuff/(of a form etc) to fill in
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
lit. mythical bird Jingwei tries to fill the ocean with stones (idiom); futile ambition/task of Sisyphus/determination in the face of impossible odds

sentences.english: In Hong Kong many square miles of land have been reclaimed from the sea.
sentences.chinese: 在香港，许多平方英里的陆地都是填海开拓出来的。

sentences.english: People here are reclaiming land from the sea.
sentences.chinese: 这儿的人们正在填海拓地。

sentences.english: A good deal of the marsh was taken in from the sea.
sentences.chinese: 很大一部分沼地是由填海而成。

sentences.english: He sent reclaimed stone bridge day and night operation.
sentences.chinese: 他派人日夜运石填海造桥。

sentences.english: They are planning to redeem land from the sea.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在计划填海拓地。

sentences.english: A substantial part of the Netherlands has been reclaimed from the sea.
sentences.chinese: 荷兰主要的土地是填海开垦而来的。

sentences.english: With strong will, men can move mountain and fill seas.—and
sentences.chinese: 凭借坚强的意志，人类能够移山填海。

sentences.english: The government should listen to the voice of the people and halt any further reclamation.
sentences.chinese: 政府应听取民意，不再填海。

sentences.english: A community can remove mountains and fill seas.
sentences.chinese: 众人先进才能移山填海。

sentences.english: Pre-loading Technique is adopted to improve the soft soil in Shenzhen bay reclamation engineering.
sentences.chinese: 深圳湾填海造地工程采用堆载预压法进行软基处理。

sentences.english: Many square miles of land in this low-lying country have been reclaimed from the sea.
sentences.chinese: 这个低地国家已经填海开拓出许多平方英里的土地。

sentences.english: For the first time, we have empirical evidence that our brilliant coalition can move mountains,” Piot said.
sentences.chinese: 第一次，实证表明我们杰出的联合阵线能够移山填海。

sentences.english: Rhododendron Zaibai carefree tears, infinite heart Jingwei reclamation.
sentences.chinese: 杜鹃再拜忧天泪，精卫无穷填海心。

definition: sea sand (sand of the ocean floor or seashore)
Shenzhen or Shamchun river Guangdong, the border between Hong Kong new territories and PRC
